intro: Adenocaulon integrifolium, commonly known as the smoothleaf pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite, smooth, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its stems are often covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Adenocaulon integrifolium is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
